selfCare.title: Self Care
selfCare.intro: Self-care during pregnancy is crucial for both the mother's and baby's well-being.
selfCare.intro2: Prioritizing physical and mental health through healthy habits, relaxation techniques, and social support can help manage stress, improve mood, and prepare for motherhood.
selfCare.intro3: Key Aspects of Self-Care During Pregnancy:

nutrition.title: Nutrition:
nutrition.description: Consume a balanced diet rich in essential nutrients, including folate, iron, calcium, and protein.

exercise.title: Exercise:
exercise.description: Engage in regular, low-impact exercise like walking, swimming, or prenatal yoga, according to ACOG.

hydration.title: Hydration:
hydration.description: Drink 8-12 cups of water daily to stay hydrated and energized, says the ACOG.

sleep.title: Sleep:
sleep.description: Prioritize good sleep to manage stress, improve mood, and enhance energy levels.

stressManagement.title: Stress Management:
stressManagement.description: Practice relaxation techniques like deep breathing, meditation, or progressive muscle relaxation.

socialSupport.title: Social Support:
socialSupport.description: Seek support from family, friends, or join prenatal support groups to manage anxiety and uncertainty.

selfReflection.title: Self-Reflection:
selfReflection.description: Engage in activities that bring joy and relaxation, such as reading, taking baths, or pursuing hobbies.

education.title: Education:
education.description: Educate yourself about pregnancy changes and the birthing process to feel more in control.

prenatalCare.title: Prenatal Care:
prenatalCare.description: Attend regular prenatal appointments with your healthcare provider.

limitStressors.title: Limit Exposure to Stressors:
limitStressors.description: Identify triggers of anxiety and limit exposure to them.

listenToBody.title: Listen to Your Body:
listenToBody.description: Adjust your routine and activities based on your body's needs.

askDoula.title: Ask Your Doula
askDoula.subtitle: How can I assist you today?

options.exerciseTips1: What exercises are safe during pregnancy?

sleepScreen.welcomeText: Welcome to your bedtime calculator, pick a time to get started.
sleepScreen.timeToWakeUp: I want to wake up at...
sleepScreen.setReminderText: Set a reminder and stay on track.
sleepScreen.didYouWakeUpAt07_30AM: Did you wake up at 07:30 AM?

howItWorksPoints: A good night's sleep consists of 5-6 cycles
Each cycle lasts for about 90 minutes
Waking up in the middle of a cycle leaves you feeling tired, but waking up at the end of a completed cycle helps you feel refreshed and ready for the day!

babyDescription: In week 8, the embryo looks more and more like a human, instead of an alien. The head is about half of the entire body length.
momDescription: In week 8, people around you still won’t notice your growing belly, but you might find yourself having trouble buttoning your favorite jeans.
funFactDescription: A baby’s heart starts beating as early as 5-6 weeks, and by week 10, they already have tiny fingers.
fruitText: Your baby is the size of a {{fruit}}!

badgeDescription.EXPLORER: First time exploring all features of the app (should have navigated at least once to all habit trackers, self-care, journal).
